intro: Hieracium cernuum subsp. herejedalicum, commonly known as the nodding hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its drooping, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It has basal leaves that are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and its stems are usually unbranched. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
